    • Method Detail

      • updateInstall

        void updateInstall(int minNotificationInterval,
                 Map<String,String> customAttributes,
                 Map<String,String> targetAttributes)
        Client advises server of user changes to the install, e.g. user_interval changed from Daily to Hourly. This invokes the server API PUT /2/install
        Parameters:
        minNotificationInterval - When user changes minimum notification interval (in seconds). 0 = never. Pass a negative number to leave the notification interval unchanged.
        customAttributes - once the host app is authenticated to its own service, it can pass a token to the Incoming SDK, which is saved to the install object on the backend for use in extracting user-specific recommendations from content provider’s CMS. Pass null to ignore.
        targetAttributes - Client advises server of install attributes that can be used for targeting of push videos. Pass null to ignore.

      • setNotificationInterval

        void setNotificationInterval(int minNotificationInterval)
        Change the minimum notification interval.
        Parameters:
        minNotificationInterval - When user changes minimum notification interval (in seconds). 0 = never.

      • setTargetAttributes

        void setTargetAttributes(Map<String,String> targetAttributes)
        Client advises server of install attributes that can be used for targeting of push videos.e.g. { ‘gender’ : ‘female’ }
        Parameters:
        targetAttributes - install attributes that can be used for targeting of push videos.e.g. { ‘gender’ : ‘female’ }

      • setCustomAttributes

        void setCustomAttributes(Map<String,String> customAttributes)
        Once the host app is authenticated to its own service, it can pass information to the Incoming SDK, which is saved to the install object on the backend for use in extracting user-specific recommendations from content provider’s CMS. e.g. { ‘content_token’ : ‘1344fg18963fg’ }
        Parameters:
        customAttributes - e.g. { ‘content_token’ : ‘1344fg18963fg’ }

      • setNotificationDisplayActive

        void setNotificationDisplayActive(boolean displayNotifications)
        Activate or de-activiate notification display. Pre-fetching is also paused while notification display is disabled.
        Parameters:
        displayNotifications - Notifications will be displayed if true, or not displayed if false.

      • isNotificationDisplayActive

        boolean isNotificationDisplayActive()
        Query if notifications are being displayed to the user. Notification display may be activated or de-activated by calling setNotificationDisplayActive(boolean).
        Returns:
        true if notifications are being displayed to the user.

      • getNotificationCandidates

        List<? extends VideoDescriptor> getNotificationCandidates()
        Videos that can be added to a notification. Video has not expired. Video has been released from embargo in the last 48 hours. Videos still under embargo are omitted. List is unmodifiable.
        Returns:
        a list of videos that have been fetched. The list is sorted in the order the videos would be posted in notifications at the time the method was called.

      • getPrefetchQueue

        List<? extends VideoDescriptor> getPrefetchQueue()
        Videos that are available for download.
        Returns:

      • getWatchedVideos

        List<? extends VideoDescriptor> getWatchedVideos()
        Videos that have been watched.
        Returns:

      • getAllAvailableVideos

        List<? extends VideoDescriptor> getAllAvailableVideos()
        This method concatenates the results of getWatchedVideos() and getNotificationCandidates(). The videos are sorted in the order that would be presented in notifications. The time the video was added according to VideoDescriptor.getDiscoveredEpoch() is the primary factor in determining the order, but videos that have been from embargo recently are promoted, while expired videos are demoted.
        Returns:
        all available videos.

      • enablePrefetch

        void enablePrefetch(boolean enabled)
        Disable or enable pre-fetching. This can be used to provide a user control to turn download on and off. Downloads that are already in progress will be completed but no new downloads will be commenced. Download is enabled by default.

      • isPrefetchEnabled

        boolean isPrefetchEnabled()
